Caption: Mr. Lionel Paul receives the Governor's Prize from Sir C.V. Raman
Photographer: Mr. C. Gourishankar (1936-2002) was a multi disciplinarian. Geologist, photographer, writer, craftsman and artist are just some of the definitions that can be given to this man of versatile interests and professions. Above all, he was a perfectionist. Gourishankar was first introduced to photography as a child. He would often observe his father, a photo enthusiast himself, taking photographs, developing and printing them at home. Gourishankar’s passion was Temple Photography but his rapture for photography in general drove him to read extensively and collect more knowledge on the subject. In 1960, he took up Photography as a profession.  Gourishankar started off by doing Event Photography and Industrial Photography. As an industrial photographer he took Black and White photographs of factories, buildings and machinery for a number of Institutions. One such institution was the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras. All through the 1960’s-70’s buildings and facilities mushroomed all over the campus. The campus was amok with dignitaries, German professors and plenty of activity, convocations and other such events. This is when Gourishankar stepped in to document these radical changes taking place. His first assignment at IIT Madras was to cover the Institute Day function, April 1961. Besides taking commissioned photographs, he continued taking photographs of South Indian Iconography. Many of his photos were greatly demanded and he printed and sold many copies of them. His photographs were showcased in exhibitions held at many places including the Madras Museum, the German Consulate and Alliance Francaise.
Description: The Governor’s Prize was awarded to Shri Lionel Paul (B. Tech. in Mechanical Engineering-5 Years) who famously represented IITM in a number of inter collegiate sports tournaments and meets during his bachelor’s degree. He played Tennis, Hockey, Track & Field and Table Tennis. During his time at IITM he evolved into an outstanding singles player and won the Stanley Cup for inter-collegiate Tennis a number of times in the 1960’s. His Tennis prowess even allowed him to tuck away a win against the Wimbledon semi-finalist, Anand Amritraj one year! Lionel Paul served as General Secretary of the main student body (Gymkhana) during the final year of his B. Tech. Upon graduation he worked briefly in EID-Parry and India Pistons only to return to IITM for his M. Tech. in Industrial Engineering. Later he joined Tube Investments following which he moved to the Netherlands to join Shell International. His assignments at Shell took him to a number of countries including Canada, Kenya and Malaysia where he worked on multiple projects that ranged from managing oil refineries to LNG and Gas to Liquid Plants.
